channel.title: Npcreset command, home and shops
channel.description:
[center][b]Well, i need help with some things :S I'm also kinda new at coding, so:
1) I compiled my server, and then the shops were gone ? 2) I told you, i'm kinda new at coding, and i dont know yet how i can change the home place And last, how can i get the ::npcreset command working ?[/b][/center]

item.title: Npcreset command, home and shops
item.dc:creator: @fuckedup111 fuckedup111
item.description:
@fuckedup111 wrote:

And what about if you want to reset ALL NPC’s all over the game ? do you need to put all the NPC ID’s in it ?

Read full topic

[/quote]
You have to add the NPC’s that you want to reset in the area in which I put, “NPC ID”

@jc22493 wrote:

Go into your client class.
Put it in your customCommand void.
Just place it under any command.

item.title: Npcreset command, home and shops
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

  1. Did you touch any of the shop files?

  2. To change the coordinates where you spawn, search in your player class -

initial x and y

You should see something like this -

// initial x and y coordinates of the player heightLevel = 0; // the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper // initialization packet toX = 3086+misc.random(3); toY = 3499+misc.random(3);
Change the 3086 and 3499 to your coordinates. To find out what coordinates you’re on, type ::mypos.

  1. Here is a base for an NPCReset command -

[code]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“npcreset”) && playerRights > 0){
for (int i = 0; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) {
if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i] != null) {
if(server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType == NPC ID){
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsDead = false;
} else
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsDead = true;
server.npcHandler.npcs[i].actionTimer = 0;
}}

	yell("NPC's have been reset!");
}[/code]

Reply with any errors.

Read full topic
